definition.value: The concentration of compound that elicits an extension of circadian period length by 5 hours.
The compound concentration at which the fitted curve passes activity threshold 1000.
The compound concentration at which the fitted curve passes activity threshold 10.
The compound concentration at which the fitted curve passes activity threshold 26.
The compound concentration at which the fitted curve passes activity threshold 35.
The compound concentration at which the fitted curve passes activity threshold 40.
The compound concentration at which the fitted curve passes activity threshold 500.
The compound concentration whereupon perceived activity reaches the maximum value observed (with a positive control).
The compound concentration whereupon perceived activity (change in Tm) reaches the maximum value observed (with a positive control).
The agonist concentration whereupon perceived activity reaches the maximum value observed (with a positive control).
The compound concentration whereupon perceived activity (fold increase) reaches the maximum value observed (with a positive control).
The compound concentration whereupon perceived activity (percent inhibition) reaches the maximum value observed (with a positive control).

It is performed to quantify the interactions between two molecules, e.g. small molecule-protein, protein-protein, protein-DNA, etc.
It is performed to quantify the interactions between two protein molecules, using methods such as protein fragment complementation assay, immunoassay, radioligand binding, etc.
It reports the size and shape of cells and organelles (phenotype). These are detected by microscopy.
It is performed to measure the movement of cells and organelles (phenotype).  These are detected by microscopy.
It is used to measure the effect of a perturbagen on the enzyme activity, which can be measured either directly or coupled to a secondary signal.
This assay quantifies the expression level of the entire gene pool in a cell or a subpopulation (e.g. tissue-specific gene expression, kinases) using a bead-based method.
This reports the membrane potential of a cell by using electrophysiological techniques or by staining with dyes whose binding is dependent on the membrane potential.
Ion channel assays are performed in electrically active cells: neurons, muscle, and endocrine cells.
This assay quantifies the protein folding/conformation using technologies, such as nuclear magnetic resonance, circular dichroism are used to determine the protein folding/conformation.
It is performed to measure the redistribution of organelles and molecules within the cell (proteins, second messengers, metal ions, dyes, etc. ). This is visualized by microscopy.

This assay quantifies the amount of a mature transcript that is produced after splicing. Splicing is a modification of an mRNA intermediate after transcription, in which introns are removed and exons are joined. It can be detected by several methods, namely, the use of a reporter gene, RNA-Seq, specialiez microarrays, etc.

This assay allows the identification of new drugs that sensitize or desensitize the sensitivity of a cell to its signaling molecule (e.g calcium, light). The perturbagen has the role 'sensitizer' in this assay.
